snippet: A ship carrying as many as 700 people sank in the Mediterranean Sea north of Libya, adding to the rising death toll in what has become a migration crisis for Europe.
abstract: Some 700 people are feared dead after vessel crowded with migrants capsizes and sinks in Mediterranean Sea off coast of Libya; disaster, perhaps worst of its kind, comes as Europe faces dramatic rise in number of Middle Eastern and African migrants attempting to reach Continent by sea; rising death toll has renewed criticism of Europe's Triton program, which many say is too limited in scope and resources to deal with crisis.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Siena, Italy.

lead_paragraph: A ship carrying as many as 700 people sank in the Mediterranean Sea north of Libya, adding to the rising death toll in what has become a migration crisis for Europe.

headline.main: Hundreds of Migrants Are Feared Dead as Ship Capsizes Off Libyan Coast
headline.print_headline: Migrants Killed as Ship Capsizes Off Libyan Coast

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
